main event: An unidentified aerial object was observed over Caddo Lake, Louisiana, by a group of civilians on 22 May 1949.
interesting points: The object was reported to be silver in color and oblong,The sighting lasted approximately 3-4 minutes,The object was first spotted at about two miles away and was flying at an altitude between 6,000 and 10,000 feet at an estimated speed of 500 mph,The observers included Mr. W. S. Crary, his wife, and son, all present on a fishing trip,The visibility was good, with no sound associated with the object.
sighted object: an unidentified silver, oblong aerial object
witness description: Civilians, including a paint shop foreman and his family
